Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported
articles.content:
Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported 
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Dominican Committee for the Reunification of Korea issued a statement on Oct. 24 on the occasion of the month of supporting the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
 The statement said that President Kim Il Sung set forth the proposal as a formula for reunifying the country independently and peacefully irrespective of ideology, system, political view and religious belief.    
 Noting that leader Kim Jong Il ensured that the North-South Joint Declaration was adopted on June 15, 2000, opening a new chapter in the struggle to reunify the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation, the statement expressed unconditional support to the Korean people in their efforts to achieve the country's reunification.

Mobile Exercises of S. Korean Army Unit 
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- It was announced that the "Lightning" unit of the south Korean army would launch mobile exercises in Inchon and Puchon, Kyonggi Province, between October 28 and 30, according to south Korean KBS.
 The south Korean military authorities said that blank shots would be fired day and night in the maneuvers of the effective strength and combat equipment. .

China to Provide Grant-in-Aid to DPRK
articles.content:
China to Provide Grant-in-Aid to DPRK
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government decided to provide grant-in-aid to the DPRK.
 Wu Bangguo who is leading the Chinese state delegation on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK informed Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, of this on Wednesday.    
 This will encourage the Korean people in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful nation.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Norwegian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Norwegian Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from a delegation of the Communist Party of Norway on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the CPN, on Oct. 26.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the visiting delegation for the Juche idea and Japan-DPRK friendship.
 The floral basket was conveyed to an official concerned on Oct. 29 by head of the delegation Yusei Takara, researcher of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Delegation
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Thursday met and had a friendly talk with the friendship visiting group of the Communist Party of China led by Zhang Yi, vice-secretary of the Hebei Provincial Committee and secretary of the Hebei Provincial Committee for Discipline Inspection of the CPC.
 Present there were officials concerned.

articles.title: Wu Bangguo Pays Courtesy Call on Premier of DPRK Cabinet
articles.content:
Wu Bangguo Pays Courtesy Call on Premier of DPRK Cabinet
    Pyongyang, October 30 (KCNA) -- Wu Bangguo, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress of China, paid a courtesy call on Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Zeng Peiyan, member of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and vice-premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, and other members of the delegation.    
 On hand were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Kwak Pom Gi and officials concerned.
 A conversation took place in a friendly atmosphere.
